TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE police searched the applicant 's house .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found , upon the applicant 's complaint , that the search had been unlawful . The judgment was not appealed against and acquired legal force DATE . On DATE the Presidium of ORG rejected the ORG 's application for supervisory review and upheld the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant 's action against ORG of GPE for compensation of non - pecuniary damage sustained as a result of the unlawful search and awarded the applicant MONEY . By a decision of DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal . On DATE ORG issued a writ of execution .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant forwarded the writ of execution to ORG , but on DATE ORG returned it to the applicant on the ground that he had failed to submit a duly certified copy of the judgment of DATE and a payment request with indication of his bank account .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant re - submitted the enforcement materials to ORG . However , on DATE ORG returned them to the applicant for the reason that the date of delivery of the judgment had been indicated incorrectly .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement documents were once again forwarded to ORG .

CARDINAL . The date on which the judgment was enforced is disputed by the parties . According to the Government , the judgment was fully enforced on DATE . From the applicant 's submissions it follows that he had received the amount awarded by the judgment of DATE on DATE .
